definition[0]: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
definition[1]: happening or developing gradually over a period of time
example[2]: Britain’s progressive decline as a world power
definition[2]: the progressive form of a verb is used to show that an action or activity is continuing to happen. In English, it consists of the verb ‘be’ followed by the present participle, as in ‘I was waiting for the bus’.
definition[3]: someone with modern ideas who wants to change things
definition[4]: happening or changing over a period of time, and often becoming worse
example[4]: The results reflect the progressive collapse of sales of the company’s high-end computers.
definition[5]: supporting new or modern ideas, methods etc
example[5]: He begam his career as a progressive economist before becoming prime minister at the age of 40.
